website_summaries.verdict: While somewhat pricey, the Logitech MX Master's expansive feature set and smooth operation make it a worthwhile purchase for power users seeking a high-performance wireless mouse.
pros: The MX Master is a rechargeable wireless mouse for Macs and Windows PCs that offers smooth, precise operation, lots of customization options, good ergonomics, and works on almost any surface
You can connect to up to three computers using Logitech's included Unifying Receiver USB dongle or opt for Bluetooth connectivity
Speed-adaptive scroll wheel lets you auto-shift from click-to-click to hyper-fast scrolling and a thumbwheel lets you scroll side-to-side
cons: It's somewhat expensive, and the rechargeable battery isn't user-replaceable (but should last several years)

customer_reviews.title: ARG! Wheel scrolls by itself!!!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is great, except that if you leave the wheel in free mode (instead of ratchet) then sometimes the wheel will scroll by itself. I think the problem is that the wheel rolls really easily (good lubrication) but it's also not balanced (maybe because of how the wheel components are glued or assembled). This combination of factors means that, sometimes, this small extra weight on one side of the wheel is enough to push the wheel in one direction or another. Again, this only happens when you have the wheel in free mode (not ratchet). But it's a really annoying flaw in the design. Love the mouse otherwise. FIX PLEASE!!!
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable, Will stop working 2 out of 2 that I bought are broken.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Logitech user since the MX500 series, and my mouse has always lasted serveral computers before the need to change them. On august 2016 I changed both of my Perfomarmance MXs for 2 MX masters, Now I deeply regret throwing away my old performance MX, Both MX Masters started having the gesture button issue a year after purchase, and now one will stop working suddenly. This mouse has irreparable issues from its design that come from the use of a flexible ruberlike material for the gesture button. There are temporary fixes that you can find on forums or youtube, but they are not permanent. if you want this product buy the performance MX and not this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special
customer_reviews.text: I see nothing special about this mouse for the average computer user. I don't do gaming, so I can't respond on that level. There are lots of buttons here, but I haven't found any great need for anything but the usual left, right and scrolling. And after 9 months of use, the scroll wheel no longer works, which makes it unusable for me. I also don't like the rechargeable battery. Regular, off-the-shelf AA or AAA batteries on a standard wireless mouse lasted for months and were easy to change as needed. When this runs out of charge, it quits working and needs to be taken out of service for recharging. I'm going back to a tried and true three-button mouse.
customer_reviews.author: R. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse design; best mouse
customer_reviews.text: Perfect fit to hand. Highly configurable. Defaults are great too. I get annoyed with mouses that don't have a horizontal scroll now. This is actually why I bought this one. I have an MX Master 2 at work. The first version is so similar, I decided to save the money. So far I'm not disappointed. V3 is out now, but wasn't worth seeing if the extra cost was worth it to me right now. Only way I could see the design improved is if it were a vertical mouse since none of the current crop of vertical mouses have a horizontal scroll wheel. In short, a tilted MX Master. C'est la vie!
customer_reviews.author: M. Elam

customer_reviews.title: Been using this mouse for over 3 years
customer_reviews.text: I have been suing this mouse for 3 years, every week day, 40+ hours a week. It has never failed me. The battery lasts a good long time and when it does get low it recharges quickly. I think I charge it maybe once a week, perhaps less often. It's comfortable and looks good. My a-hole co-workers like to hide it from me. Sometimes in my desk, like in a drawer, but sometimes in a different cube so it takes me a while to find it. I hate them with the fury of a dying sun. The mouse is great, my coworkers... I hope all the bad things in life happen to only them and no one else.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisW

customer_reviews.title: Not really a WIRELESS mouse
customer_reviews.text: I chose this mouse because of its size and shape and because it would work on the glass top that covered my desk. The battery life, though, is so short that I have to plug it in to recharge every 3 - 5 days. It might as well be a wired mouse because it is tethered to the computer so often. On the other hand, I've rarely used a more ergonomically pleasing mouse. It have large arthritic hands, and this mouse allows me to stay engaged at the computer for hours longer than other ones. How I wish it just used regular batteries, though, so it would truly be a wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Terryifc

customer_reviews.title: I've used this mouse for like 4 years. Still working fine.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has good ergonomics, enough buttons for a casual gamer and a 1 or 2 week rechargeable battery life. This is probably my favorite mouse I've ever had. Works good. has what I need plus a few buttons. The micro USB charging is great. The ergos are just fine. The best thing is the scroll wheel. Give it a whip and it rooooolllllllllllls for a while like it's got some AI working in there (it's mechanical). Move it slowly and it works like a normal mouse button 3.
customer_reviews.author: Dre Freden

customer_reviews.title: Ten out of ten
customer_reviews.text: It's almost 2 years with this mouse and I LOVE IT ... Once you get used to it, you can't live without it. The best thing about this mouse is that it's customizable for each app individually and it can be used on both Mac and Windows. But one thing that you might have an issue with, is that when I use it on Windows 10 via Bluetooth it stutters so much that it becomes unusable. Although you can overcome this issue by plugging the USB adapter, it's still annoying. Other than that, it's AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Nickelz

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Warranty Is Useless!!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse actually worked OK until a few weeks ago. However, Logitech advertises a 3-year warranty on this product. I have tried for the past week to file a warranty claim with Logitech for a replacement mouse. I have three (3) separate warranty claim case numbers now assigned to me, but no response from Logitech. I seriously doubt that anyone is employed in the warranty department at Logitech. If you plan on buying Logitech products because of an advertised warranty - don't waste your time - the warranty is useless!! There are many, many posts on the Logitech forum about this very issue - you would think they would be embarrassed and ashamed by all of this bad product coverage.
customer_reviews.author: The Legal Beagle

customer_reviews.title: Died a few months short of 3 years
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed using this mouse for almost three years. As long as it worked, we (well, the user in our family who likes it; our family is divided on its design) considered it a perfect mouse. However, after using it for around 32 months, it no longer pairs over Bluetooth with our Mac. By comparison, we have an Apple keyboard and a (probably at least 10-year-old) Apple mouse that pair virtually instantaneously and are rock solid. We're very disappointed and will have to go back to the drawing board to think about whether to buy a new Bluetooth mouse (and which one).
customer_reviews.author: M. Stiber

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.  The coolness factor is completely ruined by the grim performance.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse for business as I'm a photographer. I work on a computer about 50% of the time. The computer operation and fluency at which I control my images is paramount to the future of my service. I consider the equipment I use as being part of the payroll department of my business. If the equipment doesn't work well, I don't get paid. This MX Master Logitech mouse has catastrophic control issues. The cursor skips around the screen and often stays in one spot until the lag catches up. This is unacceptable and unforgivable. Looking on Logitechs forums, this is quite an issue. Many users have and complained about this issue for years.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice beefy grip, but occasional Mac connectivity issues
customer_reviews.text: I generally like this mouse, but Logitech seems to have issues with reliable connections to Apple computers. It is often not recognized when my iMac resumes from sleep, and I have to pull out a backup USB mouse to reconnect. A recent update improved things, but the problem still happens once or twice a week. The mouse itself is solid and smooth, and the speed-adaptive scroll wheel was an unexpected bonus. I like the ratchet setting at low speeds, but freewheeling when zooming through a long document. I don't use the programmable buttons much, but the feel is excellent for my large hands.
customer_reviews.author: The RoadWarrior

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, 5 star quality as always from Logitech
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is amazing for the price. I use it on my glass desk which is usually not great without a mousepad but this thing does fine. Super responsive and the scroll wheel is addicting. You'll see what I mean when you get it. Also a great mouse for what I do (editing) because I can switch between computers without much effort. I haven't had to charge this mouse since buying it a week or so ago. Fits my hands well but I have big hands so be ready for this mouse to be bigger than you expected. You'll get used to it because it's comfortable as hell.
customer_reviews.author: A ?

customer_reviews.title: Great features, but not brand new mouse
customer_reviews.text: The mouse itself is amazing. I am yet to be using it intensively but so far so good. My low rating is for the condition of the mouse. I noticed a small piece of fiber inside the transparent box and this was a red flag. I opened the box and took the mouse out. It was in perfect condition except when turned upside down, I noticed clear marks of use on the bottom (scratches and light wear). This seems to be a used item. I have attached some photos as evidence of that.
customer_reviews.author: averroes

customer_reviews.title: Very nice mouse
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for a while now and it's been rock solid as far as functionality and performance is concerned. This is my first MX Master after having tons of Marathons in the past. Only very rarely needs charging. As a texture artist, the secondary scroll wheel has really sped up my workflow. I was a bit concerned when I realized the button that engages the scroll wheel was actually automatic (only works when the mouse is active,) but I haven't had any problems with it at all. Also it's really nice looking, so that's good. Overall very satisfied with this, hopefully it'll last me a good few years. We shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Tony P

customer_reviews.title: Great for 5 hours.
customer_reviews.text: Mouse WAS nice for the first day I used it. Then all of a sudden the ratchet scroll stopped working. I've done everything mentioned on their support forums to no avail. For this price, you'd think it wouldn't break within 5 hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Twil

customer_reviews.title: Bought this as a gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these as a gift for my parents last Christmas as they use the computer a lot but were still on mice with batteries. They've held up great with no issues. I'd still recommend them to this day. Keep in mind that this is not a gaming mouse; I assume most people would know that but just wanted to say there are better wireless Logitech mice for gaming. I've used these at work and I got through a week (5 days) @ 9 hours per day via full charge. Works just fine on Mac and PC (W10).
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Broke within weeks - definitely not worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 3 of these for people in my engineering department. Within a few weeks the scroll wheel broke on each of the mice, from my readings this is a known problem with this mouse and there is a fix for it that people can do themselves, but in my mind if I'm paying 70+ dollars for a premium mouse this issue should have been resolved by the maker of the mouse. I would not recommend these for purchase for anyone that uses the scroll wheel often, as it will break and then you'll have to either return the mouse or eat the cost of another one if it's beyond the return date on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M.

customer_reviews.title: Constantly drops bluetooth connection
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. On my Macbook Pro, it does not maintain a reliable bluetooth connection. It drops the connection constantly, often taking 15-30 seconds to reconnect. Often, I have to open Bluetooth preferences and manually re-pair the device. For $100 this thing should be flawless and it's far from that.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic, worth the money. I game and design.
customer_reviews.text: Material quality is superb, smooth surfaces and a contoured thumbrest by the horizontal scroll wheel and two thumb buttons. Vertical scroll knows when you want to smooth sail or increment. I bluetooth to a surface and usb to other machine. Switching between receivers is one simple click. The usb machine is about 14 meters from the bluetooth and connections have no lag drop. Adjustable sensitivity, responsive clicks, and a perfect weight (for my desk / chair height). Crap software, but it's a mouse. -- As of Jan 2018 the MX2 is two dollars more. I *love* this, but I do wish I had chosen that.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: This mouse will make you feel special even if you're not
customer_reviews.text: This wireless mouse is smooth and responsive. When I'm using it, I sometimes like to imagine that I'm Magneto, and the cursor on the screen is a little metal shard that I'm moving around through sheer force of will. Alas, I'm not Magneto, nor any other kind of mutant for that matter. (Except, you know, in the evolutionary biological sense.) Anyway, the mouse is great for Photoshop. I can use it for super-precise edits, such as superimposing a cut-out of Magneto's helmet over a photo of my head.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse for those with large hands.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse fits well in my large hand. The battery lasts longer than any other rechargeable mouse I've ever had, I play online games and this mouse will last a good week before needing to recharge. Tracks well don't use a mouse pad just my wooden computer desk and tracks just fine. UPDATE 6/11/2019 Well it's been just about 2 years since I received this mouse....well it died before the 2 year mark. Was strange the mouse would highlight buttons on the screen but would not click them, it was intermittent also, sometimes it would allow clicking, sometimes not... Well I now have a Amazon Basic mouse, works fine so far and was a 3rd the price...
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mouse, it's obvious why it's so popular
customer_reviews.text: I got a refurbished model of this mouse and it works like a dream on MacOS. I absolutely love the smart switching from stepped scrolling to smooth if you scroll hard with it, and the gesture button on the side (yup, the neat triangular grip is a big button!) is incredibly useful. Be sure to install Logitech's software to get the full features of this thing; you can remap every single button to basically any function you can think of. Occasionally, Bluetooth connectivity gets shaky between sleep cycles but if you open the BT preference pane it should take about 20 seconds of fiddling to get it to connect solidly again. It's not a huge deal but worth mentioning.
customer_reviews.author: Zak

customer_reviews.title: If you are thinking to replace an older MX mouse ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking to replace an older MX mouse, be aware: 1. You can no longer modify the two main buttons, other than switching from left to right. 2. It isn't really wireless--unless you want to sometimes end up with no charge. Treat it as if it were a wired mouse. 3. The upper thumb buttons are not friendly. It's not possible to hit one or the other as it was in the older MX mice, so you have to program them both the same way. This mouse is a real downgrade from the older MX mice.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Manufactured Product
customer_reviews.text: The plastic on the bottom of the mouse is slowly and continually rubbing off on my mouse pad and desk (when not using a pad). I scrub the mouse pad clean every week but by the marks always return. Figured this problem would go away on its own, but I have been using the mouse daily for 5 months with no improvement. I certainly can't recommend this mouse. And like all of the Logitech products I have purchased in the past five or so years, this mouse is just one more piece of Chinese made junk. I contacted Logitech support about this issue but didn't receive a response.
customer_reviews.author: Argus

customer_reviews.title: A great mouse for professionals or the normal user
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. It tracks perfectly and is very functional, not to mention that it is incredibly ergonomic. It tracks on about all surfaces that I have used, and there is no perceptible lag using either the Bluetooth or USB key. I even used it for some casual gaming and it was great. Having this ability to connect to multiple devices makes it easy to switch from laptop to desktop. All the buttons are great, and the preset configuration is exactly what you need out of the box, but it is very nice to have the option to remap it for specific programs. This mouse is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Jake E

customer_reviews.title: nice mouse, kinda pricey
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mouse for a couple of years. It feels great and looks great. I don't game with it. I mostly just use the 3 main buttons and scroll wheel. The thumb wheel is nice for scrolling or zoomingIt will sense position on just about any surface. I have big hands so this mouse fits nicely. It stays charged a long time and does not require a dongle. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: mach*pilot

customer_reviews.title: Best mice I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Best mice I've ever owned. I now own five of these around the house, two with laptops, two with desktops and one I travel with (in a Hermitshell travel case). These are great, i love the fact that the ratchet on the wheel can be enable an disabled with a button and the fit is great, even for someone with large hands. The only hiccup was that in one location the Bluetooth connection stutters sometimes if the user is playing music over Bluetooth. Shouldn't happen, but it does. We switched that one to the included unifying receiver and the problem went away.
customer_reviews.author: Willem R. Vandenberge

customer_reviews.title: You shouldn't use this at the office
customer_reviews.text: Very good mouse overall. I prefer the usb over bluetooth since I feel it makes a better connection. I also don't have to worry about bluetooth being on. Pros: - Love the wheel - Overall comfortable in the hand Cons: - Why is the multi-device switch on the bottom!? I have to pick it up each time to switch which is annoying. - Battery isn't the best - The side wheel doesn't work without a driver (can't use it in the office) - The thumb button doesn't work without a driver... Not the best mouse to use without the driver! Even the MX2
customer_reviews.author: ss2985

customer_reviews.title: Lasts a little over a year
customer_reviews.text: I work from home as a software developer. This is the 2nd or 3rd mouse I've purchased from the MX Masters series. They all last just over a year and then up and die. I really love the mouse and will most likely buy another but I paid $80-100 for these and they don't last as long as some $5 mice I have had for 10+ years. Granted I don't use the wired mice as much but they have had at least as much use over the years and still work.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Huffaker

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable mouse to use
customer_reviews.text: Actually bought two of these, one for work and one for home. I really like the curvature of it and how it supports my palm. The Logitech software is really nice as well. You can customize the buttons as well as the sensitivity and whether or not you the scroll wheel is smooth or has notches to it. The battery easily lasts me at least 2 weeks, if not longer.
customer_reviews.author: silverado98_nighthawk84

customer_reviews.title: sculpted flange that keeps your thumb from rubbing on the surface
customer_reviews.text: Good comfortable mouse that works on all the surfaces I have tried. I like the sculpted flange that keeps your thumb from rubbing on the surface. I do no like the scroll button on the side. It is awkward and cause me to never use it or the buttons on the side. The 2 speed scrolling wheel takes some getting used to. But It has grow on me for long document reading. The connect to other machines works well and is useful jumping to a different machines. The usb rechargeable battery last a fairly long time. I would not mind if it used replaceable batteries instead as they last longer in most mice. Cost to much for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: atrox13

customer_reviews.title: Love it but it was a bit too big
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is easy to use, responsive and has great features. Unfortunately it was too big for my hand and was uncomfortable. I ordered another Logitech MX Performance Mouse as I've had success with the model. I've been such a fan of the Logitech brand of keyboards and mice I have the same models in my home and office .
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Too large to be useful, too heavy to bother with
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This mouse is huge. I'm a 6'3" man and I think this mouse is unusable. My hand cramps up, and I can barely reach the buttons. I have gone back to the Marathon mouse, which is super lightweight (can run on 1 AA for years!) has the perfect size body, and large, perfectly placed forward/back buttons. Also side-scrolling is built-in the the wheel, instead of broken out to a separate control. That said, it is a top quality mouse. Pros: Good tracking Rechargeable Customizable buttons Cons: So large as to be useless Forward/back bottons are too small to be useful Heavy
customer_reviews.author: prime addict

customer_reviews.title: Buy the Performance MX instead.
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself some money and buy the previous Performance MX model. This mouse feels awful and uncomfortable while using. The forward and back buttons are so small and so closely placed that it's hard to distinguish. The side wheel just feels wrong. It would have been better to double the side wheel as a button since it's a natural spot for your thumb. The left-right on the scroll wheel is no longer there, which really sucks. I don't like this trend Logitech has been going with these MX mice, each new iteration seems to be losing features.
customer_reviews.author: Xi Jing Pooh

customer_reviews.title: Hole Worn Through Thumb Rest Area
customer_reviews.text: It's great they brought back the software controlled scroll wheel. Otherwise it has issues. The thumb buttons could be separated better. Having them so close does nothing to help. I've had mine for a year now and the thumb rest area has worn a hole through it. It's pretty bad that a $100 mouse (at launch and time of purchase) could be worn through by regular use. With the 2S out now, there probably isn't a reason to buy this mouse anymore. Of course the new one is again $100 and who knows if usage will wear holes through the thumb rest.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Risto

customer_reviews.title: Great, for about a year.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse worked great, for about a year. Loved the ergonomics, loved the weight, loved everything about it, really. Unfortunately, it just up and died. I purchased this back in Feb 2017, it's now March 2018 and I've been having a ton of issues with it for the past month and a half, lagging cursor, buttons not working, buttons ghosting, etc. I thought nothing of it at first, but now that it just up and died, it kind of makes sense. This mouse is way to expensive to only last a year and it's insane how quickly it died.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Great for Mac users!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse! It interfaces very well with Mac OS X using Logitech's software, especially nice is the gesture support and smooth scrolling. As for the wireless connection, I was originally just using Bluetooth but it was fairly unstable, so I started using the provided USB wireless receiver and that cured the problem. I'm getting a month or more on a full charge with light use. When it does get low recharging is fast and it can be used while recharging. The mouse is comfortable in the hand and tracks nicely. However, the click buttons are very loud. That's really my only complaint. All it all, a great replacement for the "magic" mouse that ships with Apple desktops.
customer_reviews.author: G. Garthe

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I'm writing this review approximately two years after I purchased two of these. Overall, it's a great mouse and it does everything they say it does and more. However, the concerns people have about the battery life are real. The battery on both mice dies approximately a day of use and there's no way to replace it. I would give this product 5 stars, but the battery issue is real. If you do not have a usb cord with you at all times, this mouse can be a serious liability.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse
customer_reviews.text: I would have given this 5 stars except for these things: 1. The horizontal scroll bar. It will work on one page of a spreadsheet but if you go to another page you have to place the cursor on the Excel scroll bar before the mouse horizontal wheel will work. 2. I miss the cradle in the previous models 3. I miss the easily replaceable batteries. Other than that I like the battery life and the feel of the mouse. I have 2 of these, one for home and one for work. I haven't had any issues with either of them. They both get a lot of use. I have had the one at home for well over a year.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: MX Master stopped working
customer_reviews.text: After some a couple years (3), my MX Master mouse stopped working, the mouse pointer is not moving at all. Scroll wheel and buttons work ok, seems that the LED which moves the mouse pointer is the issue. I already opened the mouse and checked the internals, because the thumb button got stuck, I almost leave it for no use. I don't want to bother reopening it again, I would have to buy the plastic pads, etc. Don't get me wrong, ergonomics, battery life, and functionality were awesome. Please do buy a hard protecting case and use it when you carry the mouse in your backpack, I didn't :(
customer_reviews.author: IvanC

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable mouse I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: My favorite mouse ever, I can use it for hours without hand cramping. I use it on my Macbook Pro using Bluetooth so I don't have to use up one USB port. It has never given me issues except when I first started playing Minecraft with my son. I would jerk my thumb under attack and that would depress the button located in the thumb area which would show all open applications. I never used that anyway so I turned it off in the included software and now survive in Minecraft. The software opens up so many settings that you can customize it's incredible.
customer_reviews.author: W. T. McWilliams

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable mouse. Great battery life
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable mouse. Great battery life. I use it for my work PC connected wirelessly using the included USB adapter. I often take it home when I need to do evening or weekend work. It connects to my bluetooth devices at home fine. One issue: the horizontal scroll wheel doesn't predictably select tabs in SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS). It works fine for selecting sheets in an Excel workbook, though. The included software makes configuring the mouse easy and I really like how the mouse can save up to 3 devices (example: a mouse profile for your work computer, your tablet, and your home PC can be selected with a button press).
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: but am I really going to love a mouse so much that I'd carry it around ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow. A friend had this thing, and after using it once, I bought my own. I remember thinking "It pairs to three different PC's; yes, I use three different ones, but am I really going to love a mouse so much that I'd carry it around between them?" The answer is yes, yes I do. So much so that I bought a case (cause my bag is small, and this guy isn't) to clip on, and it goes everywhere with me. This model's been superseded, so you're probably getting it used (I did), and I've got no regrets at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Dyer

customer_reviews.title: MacBook owners beware.
customer_reviews.text: New MacBooks beware, the bluetooth connection is faulty and jitters a lot, logitech is aware but won't take responsibility. Works with the dongle and some usb-a to usb-c adapter. July 2017 Edit: Dropped to one star since the Logitech Option Application crashes everytime you try to click the Customize All Applications Preset, rendering custom behavior of the buttons useless. This is a crippling issue and many reports have been made with no solution from Logitech. December 2017 Edit: Logitech Options is up and running again; updated the score to 3, because it still jitters.
customer_reviews.author: rafagrullon

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is advertised as a bluetooth and mac OS ...
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is advertised as a bluetooth and mac OS compatible mouse. It's not. At least not at the same time. Checkout the loooong logitech support forum of people complaining they are unable to keep this mouse connected via bluetooth under Mac OS X:  Logitech has not admitted this problem exists and I do not think they plan to address it as far as I can tell.... Perhaps they can't due to the nature of OS X but if that is the case they should not advertise this as a bluetooth Mac OS compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Patrick Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Sexy Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: A fantastically well build responsive and beautifully designed mouse. Connecting is a breeze, charging is fast. It is large and its what I wanted but it does take time to get used to after using small mice for so long. I have to say is the sexiest mouse I've ever seen! (Btw I prefer human) It has an interesting scroll option, there is a magnet inside that with a click puts the scroll into a smooth and fast nonstop scroll, or click again and into about 5 lines at a time. All and all, its amazing and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: David V. sargent

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product now that MacBook bluetooth issues have been resolved.
customer_reviews.text: Recent updates to MacOS seem to have resolved the bluetooth issues discussed below. I've updated my prior review to 5. ----- The mouse itself is great: very comfortable and customizable using the software you can install from the manufacturer's website. Unfortunately, the bluetooth link with my MacBook Pro (2016) is very inconsistent. While my Magic Mouse always connects immediately, I often have to go into bluetooth settings for the computer to find the mouse. Judging from the posts I've found on the web in trying to solve this problem, I'm not alone in experiencing this problem. If it were not for the bluetooth connectivity issue, I would give this a 5.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 years.
customer_reviews.text: The battery went after 2 years. Worked flawlessly till then. It would quit working even though it showed fully charged. It would also shut down the wired Logitech key board. I would have to restart the computer. Replaced it with a wired mouse and no problems. Opened it up and removed the battery, but my careful attempt killed it completely. First Logitech product that let me down. Going to purchase the newer version (MX Master 25) with a 4 year protection plan. Hope it's not 2 bad buys.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Smiel

customer_reviews.title: usb receiver
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is awesome. Is pretty decent size. However, they could design a port in the mouse to safely put away the usb receiver. When I was in a hurry and left the receiver connected it damage the port in my labtop. I bought the case for this mouse perfect fit, but I have to be careful when I open because I have drop the receiver multiple times. Is another worry that you're going to have thinking about the receiver. It'll be great for future design to install a space in the mouse to safely put away the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible experience. This is about my 10th mouse from ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible experience. This is about my 10th mouse from Logitech. It produces spurious scroll commands. Unusable. The internet is full of similar complaints and a not my problem attitude from Logitech. Tried their driver which apparently has been "tweaked" to mask defective hardware. What a joke. How can a company be so incompetent after so many years. And so unethical as to lie that there is not problem.  Also after several attempts to register product (required by Logitech) I gave up after "a problem occurred, please try again later" and all info deleted. I will never buy a Logitech product again.
customer_reviews.author: Phone User

customer_reviews.title: CAD users listen up!
customer_reviews.text: Best mouse I have ever used. I am a design engineer and spend lots of time in 3D modeling programs at my desk. Smaller mice were making my hand cramp up. The hand feel is great, I love that it is rechargeable. I use this mouse for weeks on end without recharging and it can be used while charging. The auto-scroll feature is great for long documents. I don't use the aeropeak thumb button or the side to side scroll often but they are neat features to have as well. Recommended for CAD professionals, gamers, and power users of any kind.
customer_reviews.author: DIYDADDY

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this one to replace my dying Performance Mouse. Some nice improvements over the older style mice although this one has been replaced with a newer model. I can't imagine going back to a mouse with a mouse ball!! This one as most of the Logitech models will work on just about any surface so no more mouse pads necessary either. Mine doesn't look like the picture as it is all black with no gold trim but it matches my tower, speakers and lamp. I still haven't figured out a good use for the wheel on the side though. Maybe for advancing a page at a time??
customer_reviews.author: Desert Rat

customer_reviews.title: Almost returned it...
customer_reviews.text: I was about to return this mouse. I loved everything about it expect the scroll wheel. My old mouse had a physical scroll wheel that clicked. I'd been using that mouse for about 10+ years. So, when I started using the MX master and the scroll wheel didn't click, I was losing my mind! However, there is a little button below the scroll wheel, that if clicked, will transform the scroll wheel to a physical click scroll wheel. Because of that, I now love this mouse! So you can have either a smooth scroll wheel or a "clicking" wheel. I prefer the clicking. Lovely mouse!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Loses charge overnight if computer is asleep, infinite scroll is not infinite after a couple months of use
customer_reviews.text: Wireless is great, but if you put your computer to sleep the mouse loses charge overnight. I have to charge it the next day for ~30 minutes to be able to use it for the rest of the day. Also, the infinite scroll mechanism has lost a lot of momentum so now it only spins for a little bit and stops. My Logitech MX400 mouse that has seen years of use and my wireless MX Marathon both have perfect infinite scroll. I've only owned this mouse for a couple of months. The mouse works and is very comfortable, but the couple of drawbacks make it non ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Crazysheep

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse for it's price
customer_reviews.text: Extremely love this mouse. I use it for gaming, and I love it way more than the gaming-oriented mouses. It's just so much easier to use, and I do love that you can change how fast the scroll wheel spins, or how it spins at least. I also love that you can change the settings of the 2 buttons on the side as well as that wheel to do pretty much whatever you want it to. I personally have it as back space and go forward for the 2 buttons, and volume controller for the wheel on the side. Great mouse, but it's a bit expensive. It's totally worth the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, Except that Battery Life is Waining After 1.5 Years of Ownership
customer_reviews.text: Best thing is that it works well on the clear plastic mat I have on my leather-top desk. None of my previous mouses did. Big plus. Only complaint, and it's minor, is that the battery life isn't what it used to be. Used to get 5 or 6 weeks between charges. Now it's down to about 3 weeks. Wish I could simply replace the battery. That said, the fact that I can use it while it is recharging means I will probably stick with it for a while longer. Still a solid 5-star purchase all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff M.

customer_reviews.title: Bad mouse for UHD and bigger hands
customer_reviews.text: Far and away the worst Logitech mouse I've ever owned. Pros: Mouse looks cool Cons: Blue tooth or USB seems to get much more interference than any other mouse I have. This cause laggy/skipping mouse pointer. As far as I can tell, it's not made for UHD. The only way to get a reasonable mouse speed is to change your windows settings AND LogiOptions (not SetPoint). Then you have to remove KHALMNPR.exe from your startup (this is Logitech's way of reseting windows mouse options to default on startup) The ergonomics are lacking if you have slightly larger than normal hands. In order to use any of the thumb buttons, you have to bend your thumb back quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hurley

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable piece of 'sculpted' crap
customer_reviews.text: Performance MX is leaps and bounds better for hand feel. Ratcheting scrollwheel thing is cool, but odd shape and feels like a rock in the hand. Fwd/back buttons are stupid shape and hard to use. 3x dongle switching and BT compatability is only plus. Thumb scrollwheel is poorly placed and not high enough resolution. I have owned a half dozen performance mx mice, some before and have bought another after the mx master. Wtf Logitech the "sculpted" surface is ridiculous. I don't care that someone carved a block of wood. Garbage. (edit 6/18/18 for mobile typo corrections, add followup commentary)
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Functional and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Quite comfortable. It helped me a lot to have the adjustable scroll wheel. Not having to replace the battery is awesome. Additionally, it can pair to its USB dongle, or a computer already equipped with Bluetooth. That means I could use it at work or home, which is nice. The only thing I would change is that there could be more options for the side buttons. The included software lets you assign the buttons on the side to different functions on your computer. However, there are a couple of function I thought would be obvious choices, which aren't there.
customer_reviews.author: T. Blikstad

customer_reviews.title: Love It. Would Buy Again.
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I really enjoy the customization from Logitech's Options software and the mouse feels really nice in my hand. I love the smart scrolling wheel, which clicks nicely from notch to notch but will automatically engage a freewheeling mode when you scroll quickly. This is all adjustable in the Options application from Logitech. I would buy one again for sure, considering my only complaints are minor nit-picky things that really don't hinder my use of the mouse. Pros: Solid feel Customization of buttons Variable scroll wheel Rechargeable battery built in (charged through micro USB) Bluetooth or USB adapter Abaility to connect to 3 computers Cons: Power switch on bottom Small forward/back buttons
customer_reviews.author: Josh Steinberg

customer_reviews.title: Way better then I expected
customer_reviews.text: Way better then I expected. I was using a MX Revolution before and loved it and used every button on it. So looking at the MX Master I didn't see as many options. Wrong! I love this thing . It is the new best mouse ever after the MX Revolution. The MX Master is just that. The Master. I didn't think the hidden thumb button would work good but it does. I am very happy with the MX Master and highly recommend it. The only thing I wish it had was a Charging Dock. But I have gotten used to the charging cable. I use with 2009 Mac Pro
customer_reviews.author: Altech

customer_reviews.title: They see you scrollin' and you still scrollin'
customer_reviews.text: This is a good mouse. For those who may be curious, the button just behind the scroll wheel actually switches between "Controlled" scrolling and "Free" scrolling. "Controlled" with enable a stopper that sort of controls how much the wheel will scroll. Kind of like a gentle reminder that maybe you're going too fast and may want to stop and smell the internet, while "Free" will UNCHAIN THE WHEEL! You can scroll ONE time and it ill keep going forever, so far into Hell that it somehow comes back down from the top of the heavens! Controlled = brake check because maybe you missed that spicy post on online. Free = For-the-love-of-God-please-stop-I-just-wanted-to-see-a-little-further-down-on-the-page-and-not-in-to-the-deep-dark-oblivion-oh-sweet-mercy!
customer_reviews.author: Stefan M.

customer_reviews.title: Use this bad boy all day at work
customer_reviews.text: Use this bad boy all day at work. The battery lasts a lot longer than I was expecting. It always seems they exaggerate about that. But I probably get several months between charges. Often forget it's wireless. As is expected from a MX mouse it's comfortable and the scroll wheel works great. I can't install the untility on my work computer, so I cannot use the thumb wheel or buttons, but everything else works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew B

customer_reviews.title: It stutters so bad that the mouse is completely unusable
customer_reviews.text: There seems to be a major flaw with this mouse that Logitech is ignoring or can't fix. It stutters so bad that the mouse is completely unusable. The problem seems to be with bluetooth interference which is basically impossible to avoid if you say, work in an office. Their supports says to use the dongle supplied with the mouse to fix the problem, but that did nothing for me. I highly recommend avoiding this mouse. I have been a fan of Logitech products for a long time, but this expensive new paperweight I have is making me a skeptic.
customer_reviews.author: beatnick

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse BUT it wont last
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse while it works and that is the problem. I got 3 of this mouses an they all have the same issue. They work great for about a year, after that they start having connection issues, and finally they just stop working. I think a mouse from a name brand should work for more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product - battery has died 3 years later
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love my MX Master mouse and bought two others for friends. After 3 years my battery has died (I assume) as it seems to be sending errant messages very frequently to my computer to Alt-Tab and scroll to different windows. When I charge and unplug it's better, but it kept getting more frequent and now it's totally non-responsive. Does anyone know how I can get the batter replaced?
customer_reviews.author: jf_houston

customer_reviews.title: Wireless mouse is very nice. I do wished that it was somewhat larger ...
customer_reviews.text: Wireless mouse is very nice. I do wished that it was somewhat larger but it does last a long time. I work 12 hour days and forget to charge at night and it does last about 3 days fully charged on the battery. The charger is great. It has a small piece of Velcro that I use to tie around cords above my desk so it doesn't slip down the crack beneath my desk. The scroll feature is lightning fast and keeps on scrolling after you have stopped. Have recommended to my business to purchase them for the office
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good, not perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Always have loved Logitech products, so when my Trackmarble went belly up, I thought I'd try a mouse, as I've used Trackballs and Trackmarbles for over 20 years. Ergonomic and smooth scroll. Only complaint is the Forward/Reverse buttons. Reverse is easy to engage, but the Forward button, right on top of it, is a disaster. They should have had some decent amount of "separation" between the buttons. Whenever I try to engage the Forward button, my thumb catches the additional scroll wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Perez

customer_reviews.title: its a nice piece but this is the second time I purchased ...
customer_reviews.text: mouse started giving problems 2 months after I purchased it, I contacted the seller and there attitude was "its your problem call Logitech and see if they will give you a refund", I wouldn't advise anyone to buy from this seller. as for the product....! its a nice piece but this is the second time I purchased a hi end Logitech product and its the second time I'm having problems...
customer_reviews.author: Marc S. Davids

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for short period of time.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it a while back and it was awesome at first, but short after the button that changes the scroll wheel mode stopped working, Then i had Bluetooth issues with or without the connector that comes with it. It just has been a big let down because i love the shape and what the mouse can do. I looked for ways to fixed the scroll wheel issue online and and its a hardware problem that you can personally fix quickly but 2 weeks after it will go back to not working and that its just not worth the money that this mouse costs. i have an older mouse that still works perfect and costs half as much. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Pavel Aragon

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a rechargeable mouse that doesn't stop me while it's charging!! Charge may not last as long as advertised.. but if it shows red, I just plug in a USB cable for a little while. I love that I don't have to interrupt what I'm doing to find batteries or set it on a pedestal to charge it. (finally!) Great mouse. Loved the Revolution it replaced, but glad to do away with batteries as well. Side wheel is a nice change as well, definitely better than the tilt wheel on top.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W.

customer_reviews.title: Mouse fits wonderfully in the hand and I love the scroll wheel
customer_reviews.text: Mouse fits wonderfully in the hand and I love the scroll wheel. Only reason I did not give this mouse a 5 star rating was that though you can continue to use the mouse while charging (utilizing the mini USB connector), the mouse still operates in Bluetooth mode instead of changing over to a corded mouse. If your computer does not go into Windows or if you are doing a windows restore, a corded mouse is necessary. I was hoping to finally be able to rid myself of my old corded mouse by having the best in both worlds. No such luck this time. However with all the great features, this does give Logitech one more thing to improve.
customer_reviews.author: E. Timmie

customer_reviews.title: Pretty well built and works great
customer_reviews.text: Pretty well built and works great.....however.... when are designers going to learn how to design a mouse when buttons that control certain functions should not be so close and easy to press when using their product. Who test these designs? Logitech as been my go to product for years.... I just wish someone could give them a little competition and get some ergonomic designers to recommend button placement.
customer_reviews.author: Henry R Connell, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Would reccomend for everyday work mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I love the mouse and its associated features. I'm coming from gaming mice but ultimately game less now. My work requires lots of travel and this mouse has been a lifesaver. FAVORITE PARTS - Ergonomic. Most mouses make my hand hurt after long sessions. - Great software supporting it - Hidden button a nice add on for work - Battery life has yet to be an issue. Small cons - Slightly loud on click - Side wheel isn't responsive, smooth but it'd be nice for it to be similar to the main wheel. 9/10 would recommend for an everyday work mouse
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Villani

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse, bad battery life and battery user experience
customer_reviews.text: Mouse works perfectly. however the battery life is bad. I wish it used swappable AAs or AAAs instead of a built in battery, this would reduce mouse down time significantly. The chargeable "feature" feels like an anti-feature. My portable logitech mouse uses AAAs and that thing never has any down time. Received the mouse, then it charged to full. After 10 days of use, it was dead. My review would be 5 stars if the batteries were not built in.
customer_reviews.author: Memo

customer_reviews.title: What I really dislike is the buggy driver/software
customer_reviews.text: I had this in my list for over a year. When the price finally dropped I jumped on it. Wish I hadn't. The mouse is OK .. a bit large but that's a personal preference. What I really dislike is the buggy driver/software. I never had problems with my MS BT mouse, but thought I wanted something sexier. Well, this has the fast scroll feature, but it's buggy. It jumps in random and wrong directions and so I rarely have it on. Problem is, the regular mode is too slow and not as adjustable as I would like.I almost returned it, but was too lazy. It works, but I wouldn't recommend it to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: T. Beaulieu

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is worth so much it's not funny. I'll say this
customer_reviews.text: This is the third version of this mouse I've owned. I've converted so many coworkers from standard mice to this or other stuff. This mouse is worth so much it's not funny. I'll say this: The original Logitech MX I have is about 10 years old. It looks like it's been through a dog, so it's at my house. The brand new one, it's at work. STILL WORTH IT. The materials that coat it are decent but the fit are worth passing it down to your grand children!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Pointer sticking isues never resolved
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse. I have bought four of them and love them. Why the two star rating? This mouse has a physical manufacturing problem where the gesture button sticks causing the mouse pointer to freeze or become jumpy. I files a support ticket with Logitech and never heard a single word back from them. NOT GOOD. Quite a few users are reporting the same problem and Logitech has not fixed it or admitted to the problem. I really like Logitech products, but this is not an inexpensive mouse. Logitech... if you're listening, why hasn't this issue been addressed?
customer_reviews.author: Guruka S. Khalsa

customer_reviews.title: irregardless of price - I am truly happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I sit at a computer at least 8 hours a day... and have always preferred Logitech mice and keyboards. I never skimp on dollars when purchasing mice and keyboard, and this mouse is certainly not the most expensive, nor is it the cheapest. However, irregardless of price - I am truly happy with this purchase. Favorite Logitech mouse so far, and I have been using their mice since 2006. (my 3rd mouse purchase for my own use) Also note, right after getting this mouse several of my employees were jealous - and so as we replace other mice in our office, this is the new go to mouse.
customer_reviews.author: jphilly5615

customer_reviews.title: Best Wireless Mouse I have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Best wireless mouse I have ever used. Some of the best features: - Horizontal scroll - Free scrolling middle wheel - Sensor precision and accuracy - Battery life The major downsides for this mouse is that it may be too big for some people depending on your grip style. I use a claw grip and see myself needing to change my grip style for this mouse - if only the bump on the left side is a bit lower. If you can try it out in person before purchasing. I don't regret this purchase at all, especially during a sale.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Zhang

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse for Design, Software Can Be Problematic
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse, replacing a MX Revolution, which was lost in a fire. Ergonomics are great, side roller is great, and the ratchet wheel is as great as it ever was. The Logitech Software is buggy, and doesn't always work on my MacBook Pro, but a recent update seems to have fixed that problem. I had to do A LOT of searching to get the software & Unifying Receiver working - the mouse would work, but Logitech's "Control Center" would not detect the mouse. Logitech has since released "Logitech Options" which seems to have corrected the problem and let me confiture all of the mouse buttons. Initially, I could only use the mouse and not adjust any of it's many settings.
customer_reviews.author: Jono

customer_reviews.title: Scrolls pages on it's own, Terrible ergonomics for back/forward button.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of the Performance MX version and have been using it for years. I wore that one out and needed a new mouse and "upgraded" to this one. However, the mouse wheel is horrible on this. It scrolls all the time without touching it making websites jump up and down constantly. After reading up on this mouse, it's a super common issue and complaint. Also, the back and forward buttons are nearly impossible to reach with my thumb the Performance MX was perfect. Overall this mouse is a huge downgrade both in ergonomics and functionality. I wanted to like it, but it fails miserable at it's most basic operations (scrolling and clicking buttons)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Sieker

customer_reviews.title: Happily non-disappointed by this as a replacement for the (famous but discontinued) MX revolution mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I reluctantly retired my Logitech MX Revolutions (I had 2, so one was always sitting charged in the cradle), and settled on this as the replacement. The only thing I don't love is the lack of a cradle for charging (plugging it in is a pain in the butt compared to dropping a mouse into a cradle at the end of the day), but that's a seriously small complaint. Beyond that, the ergonomics are fantastic, the additional buttons and scroll wheel are great, and the software for custom-mapping the buttons is *vastly* improved. Highly recommended to the extent that I'll likely buy a second one just to always have a fully charged mouse waiting for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment for a replacement for a Performance MX
customer_reviews.text: Huge disappointment for a replacement for a Performance MX. I have dual monitors, with the old Logitech software you can crank the pointer speed up high enough to scroll both monitors with a single movement. Not so with this "new and improved" software that you have to use with the MX Master. Forget a single movement to scroll two monitors, get used to picking up the mouse 1/2 way through and restarting the motion. Greatly disappointed Logitech...might want to take a look at why the older software was so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Phxrising

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: This is not what I expected in stepping up from the previous Performance MX mouse. While it is comfortable, and there is a great deal of customization that can be accomplished with the software from Logitech (that you should remember to download from their site after purchase!) - I'm very disappointed that they chose to keep the rather cumbersome USB connector for recharging. It is very difficult to align with the hole in the mouse when it needs to be recharged. Why can't they have a cradle, or even move to lightening USB for recharging? For $100.00 you'd think they would. It also is not as heavy as its predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: R. Surber

customer_reviews.title: Not As Good As Predecessor
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse to replace my, which I had for 7 years. This updated version is worse in every respect. The MX Master doesn't track as well as the Performance Mouse MX and I find it less comfortable (though this will obviously vary by person). The worst aspect of the MX Master is that the application specific configuration of the buttons randomly stop working. To re-enable the application specific settings you must open up the Logitech Options program. This isn't the end of the world, but it is a persistent random nuisance. There are several threads on the Logitech support forums about this bug, but no real solution.
customer_reviews.author: McGrumbles

customer_reviews.title: I've been spoiled
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mouse to use on my laptop because who wants to use the touchpad. The upsides are that Bluetooth means I get to save a usb slot, the mouse has great functionality with useful buttons like the thumb alt tab feature, and it has the best scroll wheel I've ever experienced. The downside is that I now can't ever use any other mouse again because every other mouse is inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest

customer_reviews.title: Changed from the Logitech MX Anywhere 2
customer_reviews.text: Changed from the Logitech MX Anywhere 2. The Logitech MX anywhere was once a great mouse, however the latest version is a bit lacking. The side button feels cheap and does not have a solid feeling actuation, rather it is quite spongy. What else can be said about the MX Master? Great sculpted design, amazing scroll function that switches between ratchet and free spin (and note that the tension required for this can be adjusted). Battery life is amazing, often lasting multiple weeks with heavy usage. Overall, an amazing mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for desktop and laptop
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for over a year and still love the feel and functionality. The multi-device capability is a handy feature I use and appreciate. Battery life is phenomenal. I've tried using it for gaming, but there's just enough latency for that scenario to make it unsuitable for that use (but no stars deducted because they don't claim to be a gaming mouse -- just mentioning it for information).
customer_reviews.author: Craig Edward Given

customer_reviews.title: Scroll wheel failed within a month
customer_reviews.text: The scroll wheel is failing. It randomly and constantly scrolls up or down when you aren't even touching the wheel. This makes surfing any page undesirable. I just did a search of the other reviews and there are many know issues with the scroll wheel. I am so disappointed. This was not a cheap mouse. I have only had it a little over a month; just past the return period. I just ordered a new mouse (different Logitech) and hope that one fairs better. I also include the 3-year protection plan for $3. Wish I would have purchased that for this one too.
customer_reviews.author: The Cozy Reader

customer_reviews.title: This mouse and keyboard combo helped me keep my desk clean while connecting to 3 computers.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse helps me keep my desk uncluttered. I have 3 different computers and 2 displays/screens on my desk and I wanted to use 1 wireless keyboard and 1 wireless mouse to connect to all of them. The Logitech K810 Bluetooth Illuminated Wireless keyboard and the Logitech MX Master Wireless Mouse do the trick. The keyboard switches between the machines successfully 90% of the time, the mouse makes the switch 100% of the time. Thanks Logitech for helping me keep my desk organized.
customer_reviews.author: ewillig

customer_reviews.title: Broken scroll wheel, broken support model
customer_reviews.text: After four weeks (two of which I was on vacation and not using the device), the ratchet on the scroll wheel no longer works. The wheel is imbalanced, and without the ratchet, pages and documents scroll uncontrollably when I move the mouse. I just barely missed the return window with the seller. My previous logitech mouse worked for years with no problems (including the ratchet on the scroll wheel). To make it worse, logitech support hasn't responded to my case. It's been 48 hours since opening the ticket. Even the website says to expect long wait times for replies to open support cases!
customer_reviews.author: Roachmotel

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse (with one minor nit)
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy with large hands, and this larger mouse is a better fit for me than my old Logitech M705. I really like the thumb wheel for quickly switching between browser tabs. My only nit: the wheel on the MX Master does not tilt for horizontal scrolling like the wheel on the M705 does. Yes, I could make the thumb wheel perform horizontal scrolling, but I like it for tab-switching better, and I can't stop trying the shove the wheel left and right when trying to scroll horizontally...old habits and all.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M

customer_reviews.title: Best Productivity Mouse I Have Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: Really freaking great mouse. Best I have ever used for productivity. It also integrates amazingly with OS X. Pros: - Supports built in OS X gestures for programmable buttons - Extremely high build quality + design - Free spinning track wheel that unlocks on its own - Multi computer support - Great battery life Cons: - Thumb button is hard to press making it not very useful - Back/forward buttons (next to side wheel) are somewhat awkward to hit but I might just need to get used to it more - Would prefer adjustable weighting
customer_reviews.author: Stefan T. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mouse for large hands
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this mouse. It feels great in my large hand. I love that I can customize the buttons and use the thumb button as an enter-key. It’s been my daily work mouse for about a year and a half and I haven’t had any issues with the scrolling wheel as some of the reviews have posted. It took me a while to find a mouse that felt just right in my hand to avoid any carpal tunnel wrist issues that I’ve had in the past because of using mice that were too small or awkward. I just bought a back up in case this one does bite the dust.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: The thumb down option button has a knack for getting ...
customer_reviews.text: The thumb down option button has a knack for getting stuck. You'll know this happened when everything else works but the cursor doesn't move. There are several online videos on how to pry it loose or even disassemble it to disable the button.
customer_reviews.author: Nauip

customer_reviews.title: ergonomically it feels really nice, I rarely use the side buttons but the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a gamer, but I work on my laptop regularly (it docks to become my desktop computer at home, at the office, and I take it to client sites). This mouse ALWAYS goes in my laptop bag, it's an absolute must-have. ergonomically it feels really nice, I rarely use the side buttons but the horizontal scrollwheel is nice, and the smart speed wheel thingy is epic. I run linux, so I haven't had the time to mess with some of the more advanced features that other OS users probably have out of the box, but I'm sure they're also very nice.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Cadillac of non-gaming mice.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. I had one just like it that my cat knocked on the floor and broke, so I was quite happy to find it here on Amazon for HALF the price I paid for my first one. This is the Cadillac of non-gaming mice and the best I have ever owned. It works with either blue tooth or USB. Just be aware you need Logitech's Options software to use it with USB. Otherwise it works with any blue tooth connection.
customer_reviews.author: NavyRet

customer_reviews.title: Best Dark Field wireless mouse to date, hands down
customer_reviews.text: Love every thing about this mouse. I'm disappointed to see so many scathing reviews. As a user of the dark field MX series since their inception, this mouse, by far is the best yet. This mouse fits my hand perfectly, feels fantastic and very responsive. Thumb scrolling is brilliant and the hyper scroll click unlock function of the main wheel is a great idea to quickly get through lots of pages without wearing out the internal clicker. The surface is smooth and it works perfect on a glass surface. The multi channel capability as well as the Bluetooth interface are also fantastic. With builtin Bluetooth now on most computers, this allows connectivity without the use of the mini adapter.
